flow-definition.description:
FoodFund Auth Service - Helm-based CI/CD Pipeline for Authentication Microservice
This modern pipeline leverages Helm Charts for advanced deployment strategies: - Code checkout from Git - Dependency installation - Code linting and formatting checks - Unit testing - Docker image building and pushing - Helm chart validation and templating - Helm-based Kubernetes deployment with rollback capabilities - Slack notifications with Helm deployment details
New Helm Features: - Helm template validation - Multi-environment support with values files - Automatic rollback on deployment failure - Dry-run deployments for testing - Version-controlled deployments - Dependency management (PostgreSQL, etc.)
Parameters: - SERVICE: Choose which service to deploy - ENVIRONMENT: Target environment (staging/production) - HELM_ACTION: Choose deployment action (upgrade/install/rollback) - ROLLBACK_REVISION: Specify revision for rollback - SKIP_TESTS: Skip test execution - DRY_RUN: Perform template validation only - UPDATE_DEPENDENCIES: Update Helm dependencies
